data.sampled:
[$1.10] [$1.04] [$8.03] [-$.85] [-$.65]

The breakeven stock price is the lowest price that will make the investment break even. In this case, the breakeven stock price is $1.10. This is because the cost of the put is $1.10, and the cost of the call is -$.85. The total cost is $1.10 + (-$.85) = $1.05. The difference between this and the strike price is ($185 - $1.05)/$1.05 = $.90, which is more than the breakeven stock price of $1.10. Therefore, the investment will not break even.
